title: Lothar Matthaus rips into Christian Eriksen and claims midfielder is 'too slow' to play for Bayern
text:
Lothar Matthaus has urged former side Bayern Munich to avoid Christian Eriksen as a free agent next summer because the Tottenham midfielder 'is too slow' to succeed in their side.

Eriksen has failed to agree to a new contract in north London and will be available to walk away from Tottenham for free next summer.

He is able to speak to teams outside of England as early as January to talk about pre-contract agreements but Matthaus is not sold on the playmaker and wants to see Bayern invest their time and money in other targets.

Bayern Munich should avoid Christian Eriksen as he is 'too slow', according to Lothar Matthaus

The Bayern and Germany legend feels that the Bundesliga champions should look to others

'If he is not enough for Tottenham, he is not good enough for Bayern,' Matthaus told Sport1. 'Uli Hoeness has also said that Bayern do not need substitutes.

'Eriksen is a fine technician, a typical No 10. But he's too slow, and Niko Kovac likes fast players.

'For me, Eriksen is not the kind of player who makes all the difference at the highest level, so concentrate on the transfer of Kai Havertz next summer, and you still have Philippe Coutinho, who plays well as a 10.'

More to follow.
description: Lothar Matthaus has urged former side Bayern Munich to avoid Christian Eriksen as a free agent next summer because the Tottenham midfielder 'is too slow' to succeed in their side.
